meanings.definition: To breed with individuals outside of one's own group or population.
meanings.sent1: The farmer decided to try outbreeding his cows with a neighboring farm's bulls.
meanings.sent2: Many species benefit from outbreeding to increase genetic diversity.
meanings.sent3: The rabbits were tired of outbreeding with the same group and wanted to meet new partners.
meanings.sent4: In the world of flowers, outbreeding can lead to beautiful hybrids with unique colors.
meanings.sent5: Outbreeding helps prevent inbreeding and keeps populations healthy.

meanings.definition: The act of mating with individuals from a different genetic background.
meanings.sent1: Outbreeding can introduce new traits into a population.
meanings.sent2: Some animals have evolved mechanisms to promote outbreeding.
meanings.sent3: The zookeepers organized an outbreeding event to pair up animals from different regions.
meanings.sent4: In the wild, outbreeding can be a natural way to adapt to changing environments.
meanings.sent5: Outbreeding is essential for maintaining a diverse gene pool in a species.
